results.title: Pond (Episode 2)
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Campbell and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Examines the interdependent embers of a pond community. Observes life forms above and blow the surface of the water. From he Ecology series, No 2.

results.title: Pompeii and Vesuvius
results.brief_description: Shows an actual eruption of Mt Vesuvius and against this background recalls the destruction of the city of Pompeii in 79 AD. The film depicts present-day life in the ruined city of Pompeii and life in the cities and villages around Naples, including folk dancing in Sorrento.

results.title: Polyurethane progress
results.brief_description: A technical film dealing with research, manufacturing processes and the development of outlets for the rigid and flexible foam plastic industry. Illustrates the advanced scientific methods of production, including the moulding of foam car seats by micro-wave units, and the application of rigid foam to wall and other surfaces for insulation purposes.

results.title: Polychrome phantasy
results.brief_description: In this early film Norman McLaren shot crystal formations through a low-power microscope, using polarized light with the lower part of the picture masked off. The film was then rewound and a scene of dancers was filmed. No dialogue or music.
results.description: In this early film Norman McLaren shot crystal formations through a low-power microscope, using polarized light with the lower part of the picture masked off. The film was then rewound and a scene of dancers was filmed. No dialogue or music.

results.title: Pollution: is anybody doing anything about it?
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service Productions and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: This film shows that industrial, home and noise pollution are occurring more often in society. It shows that individual selfishness is to blame for much pollution. The role of the Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works (MMBW) in detecting and preventing pollution especially sewage pollution, is shown. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Pollution
results.brief_description: The activities of the Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works have been extended since the introduction of legislation authorising penalties for polluters. Shows checks on atmospheric and noise pollution; monitoring of rivers, drains and Port Phillip Bay for water pollution; and plans to rectify Melbourne’s inadequate sewerage system. Looks at progress towards the restoration of the Yarra.

results.title: Pollution
results.creator_credit: Bank of New South Wales and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with air, harbour and beach pollution in Sydney, from car exhausts, chimney discharge, rubbish dumping and the disposal of sewage into the sea. This hard hitting appraisal of the situation deplores the unfortunate attitudes of people and industry to this ever increasing problem which is affecting our way of life.
